org.w3c.dom.as
Interface ASContentModel

All Superinterfaces:
ASObject
public interface ASContentModel
extends ASObject

The content model of a declared element.

See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 3 Abstract Schemas and Load and Save Specification.

Field Summary
static short AS_ALL
          This content model represents a simplified version of the SGML &-Connector and is limited to the top-level of any content model.
static short AS_CHOICE
          This constant value signifies a choice operator.
static short AS_NONE
          Neither a choice nor sequence operator.
static short AS_SEQUENCE
          This constant value signifies a sequence operator.
static int AS_UNBOUNDED
          Signifies unbounded upper limit.
static short AS_UNDEFINED
          This content model is undefined, and is associated with incomplete element declarations in the ASModel, meaning elements implicitly declared through an attribute list but without any corresponding element declarations.
 
Fields inherited from interface org.w3c.dom.as.ASObject
AS_ATTRIBUTE_DECLARATION, AS_CONTENTMODEL, AS_ELEMENT_DECLARATION, AS_ENTITY_DECLARATION, AS_MODEL, AS_NOTATION_DECLARATION

Field Detail

AS_UNBOUNDED

static final int AS_UNBOUNDED
Signifies unbounded upper limit. The MAX_VALUE value is 0xFFFFFFFF FFFFFFFF. This needs to be better defined in the generated bindings.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AS_SEQUENCE

static final short AS_SEQUENCE
This constant value signifies a sequence operator. For example, in a DTD, this would be the ',' operator.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AS_CHOICE

static final short AS_CHOICE
This constant value signifies a choice operator. For example, in a DTD, this would be the '|' operator.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AS_ALL

static final short AS_ALL
This content model represents a simplified version of the SGML &-Connector and is limited to the top-level of any content model. No element in the content model may appear more than once. Please refer to the definition element-all.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AS_NONE

static final short AS_NONE
Neither a choice nor sequence operator.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AS_UNDEFINED

static final short AS_UNDEFINED
This content model is undefined, and is associated with incomplete element declarations in the ASModel, meaning elements implicitly declared through an attribute list but without any corresponding element declarations.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getListOperator

short getListOperator()
One of AS_CHOICE, AS_SEQUENCE, AS_ALL or AS_NONE. The operator is applied to all the components(ASObjects) in the the subModels. For example, if the list operator is CHOICE and the components in subModels are a, b and c then the abstract schema for the element being declared is (a|b|c)

setListOperator

void setListOperator(short listOperator)
One of AS_CHOICE, AS_SEQUENCE, AS_ALL or AS_NONE. The operator is applied to all the components(ASObjects) in the the subModels. For example, if the list operator is CHOICE and the components in subModels are a, b and c then the abstract schema for the element being declared is (a|b|c)

getMinOccurs

int getMinOccurs()
min occurrence for this content particle. Its value may be 0 or a positive integer.

setMinOccurs

void setMinOccurs(int minOccurs)
min occurrence for this content particle. Its value may be 0 or a positive integer.

getMaxOccurs

int getMaxOccurs()
maximum occurrence for this content particle. Its value may be 0, a positive integer, or AS_UNBOUNDED to indicate that no upper limit has been set.

setMaxOccurs

void setMaxOccurs(int maxOccurs)
maximum occurrence for this content particle. Its value may be 0, a positive integer, or AS_UNBOUNDED to indicate that no upper limit has been set.

getSubModels

ASObjectList getSubModels()
Pointers to ASObjects such as ASElementDecls and further ASContentModels.

setSubModels

void setSubModels(ASObjectList subModels)
Pointers to ASObjects such as ASElementDecls and further ASContentModels.

removesubModel

void removesubModel(ASObject oldObject)
Removes the ASObject in the submodel. Objects that already exist in the list are moved as needed.

Parameters:
oldObject - The object to be removed.

insertBeforeSubModel

ASObject insertBeforeSubModel(ASObject newObject,
                              ASObject refObject)
                              throws ASException
Inserts a new object in the submodel before the existing reference object. Objects that already exist in the list are moved as needed.

Parameters:
newObject - The new object to be inserted.
refObject - The reference object before which the new object is to be inserted.
Returns:
The object being inserted.
Throws:
ASException - DUPLICATE_NAME_ERR:Raised if a element declaration already exists with the same name within an AS_CHOICE operator.
TYPE_ERR:Raised if type is neither an ASContentModel nor an ASElementDecl.

appendsubModel

int appendsubModel(ASObject newObject)
                   throws ASException
Appends a new object to the end of the list representing the subModels.

Parameters:
newObject - The new object to be appended.
Returns:
the length of the subModels.
Throws:
ASException - DUPLICATE_NAME_ERR:Raised if a element declaration already exists with the same name within an AS_CHOICE operator.
TYPE_ERR:Raised if type is neither an ASContentModel nor an ASElementDecl.
